dct:title.value: Post-harvest storage fungi of Almonds (Prunus amygdalus Batsch.) and its sensitivity against Plant volatiles

bibo:abstract.value: Major post-harvest deteriorating fungi isolated from stored seeds of almonds were Aspergillus flavus, A. niger, Fusarium nivale, Mucor mucedo and Penicillium expansum. A.flavus and A.niger had higher % incidence than other isolated fungi. Twenty essential oils were screened against A.flavus and A.niger. Out of which, oil of Lippia alba showed absolute fungitoxicity at 40 Ã¬l/ml against both the test fungi. Study revealed that L. alba oil can be harnessed as effective preservative of almonds during storage.
